textAfterTable: TOTAL 653 106029.36 206.24 3) Sample type (SAMPLE) TOTAL % 1) General Public Sample 653 100 2) Oversample of Renewalists 0 0 TOTAL 653 100.0 [ Analyze results | Add to Question Bank | View Question Bank ] 4) Is the respondent a non-renewalist, Pentecostal, or Charismatic? Pentecostal is defined as belonging to a Pentecostal denomination or church, as indicated by responses labeled "coded as Pentecostal" in the Q4KEN. Charismatic is defined as non-Pentecostal Christians, who describe themselves as Pentecostal in question Q5C, or as Charismatic in question Q5D, or who say they speak or pray in tongues at least several times a year in the survey question named TONGUES. (RENEWLST) TOTAL % 0) Non-renewalist 289 44.3 1) Pentecostal (as coded in Q4KEN) 215 32.9 2) Charismatic (as indicated in questions Q5C, Q5D, or TONGUES) 149 22.8 TOTAL 653 100.0 [ Analyze results | Add to Question Bank | View Question Bank ] 5) Weight for use in analyzing general public samples in each country (GPWGT)
